header.overview: The header defines an algorithm that accumulates the elements of a from the last element to the first element.

macro.abstract: The macro accumulates the elements of its second argument with the operation specified by its first argument.

param.para:
The operation that is to be used to accumulate the elements of tuple. This operation must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
op(s, elem, state†)
† The state pseudo-parameter must be either ... or the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of arguments in the accumulation state, __VA_ARGS__.

macro.para:
The macro itself expands to a in terms of (s). This , when invoked by , expands to the result of accumulating the elements of tuple, from right to left, with the user-specified operation. This is illustrated by the following pseudo-code:
op(s, tuple[0], op(s, tuple[1], ... op(s, tuple[length(tuple) - 1], state) ... ))

An invocation of the operation with the current (s), a particular element (elem), and the current state (__VA_ARGS__) expands to a new state used in the accumulation of subsequent elements (or as the final result of the algorithm if no further elements exist). The operation may also expand to a in terms of (s) that expands to a new state. Expansion to a allows the operation to recurse on itself if necessary.
Invocations of the operation are trampolined such that each invocation is invoked with ((s)), where s is the original at the beginning of the algorithm (i.e. ()). This maximizes the utility of the .
